issues.title: "backward compatibility to the conventional NS-based delegation "
issues.author: moonshiner
issues.body:
*  DELEG should allow for backward compatibility to the conventional NS-based delegation mechanism. 

I believe that should be a hard requirement. In fact, I think it should be the first hard requirement.

comments.author: moonshiner
comments.body: "DELEG may enhance existing namespace semantics, but only in ways that are backward compatible"

comments.author: vttale
comments.body: Between the wording proposed for the hard requirement in Issue #2 (or something similar) and the rest of that bullet item saying that this soft requirement was about being able to derive NS records from DELEG information, I think this is covered.

issues.title: "current namespace semantics"
issues.author: moonshiner
issues.body:
Perhaps a hard requirement of:

The nameserver (NS) record type will continue to define the delegation of authority between a parent zone and a child zone with the existing semantics.

and a soft of

DELEG may enhance existing namespace semantics, but only in ways that are backward compatible.

comments.author: vttale
comments.body:
Proposed:
DELEG must be backwards compatible with the existing ecosystem. Legacy zone data must function identically with both DELEG-aware and DELEG-unaware software. Nameserver(NS)records will continue to define the delegation of authority between a parent zone and a child zone exactly as they have.

issues.title: Must support multiple operators
issues.author: moonshiner
issues.body:
This may be a hard requirement that it must be possible to transition a domain between domain operators.

This may be a soft requirement to allow multiple simultaneous operators for a domain (eg, think what drives multi-provider DNSSEC as well as large enterprises that require vendor diversity for their authoritative zones).

comments.author: enygren
comments.body:
It sounds like this a single new hard requirement should be added here, along the lines of:

* DELEG MUST enable a zone to simultaneously have multiple independent operators.

(wordsmithing is most welcome)

issues.title: "enable a DNS operator to manage DNS service more completely on behalf of registrants"
issues.author: vttale
issues.body: Discussion in the chat during the deleg meeting suggested that maybe this was a little too meta about just what was meant, but it also wasn't clear that the actual content of the document was being replied to.  But maybe add another phrase at also being able to support operators being able to update the names of nameserver targets.

comments.author: vttale
comments.body:
Proposed:
   DELEG should enable a DNS operator to manage DNS service more
   completely on behalf of domain administrators. For example, DELEG
   could address long-standing issues of DNSSEC record maintenance
   that now often depend on registrant / registrar interaction.
   Similarly, DELEG could allow new transports to be deployed by an
   operator or nameserver names to be changed, without necessitating
   that delegation information be modified by the domain administrator.

comments.author: moonshiner
comments.body: Is this hard or soft requirement?

comments.author: enygren
comments.body:
I think a hard requirement as otherwise it is a substantial regression
relative to today.
